channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous obstruction of the pavement, 12th September
item.description:
This has been an issue for months outside 95 Hayes Chase whereby there are plastic barriers across the pavement to protect pedestrians from the hazard. But it makes the matter even more dangerous because people then have to walk in the road, sometimes around parked cars, on the bend with children on their way to school, prams/pushchairs and dogs. When will this be fixed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Hayes Chase, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Mess outside residential homes, 12th September
item.description:
There has been someone constantly letting their dog(s) foul on the pavement in front of residents homes along the 80-86 Boleyn Road N16 8JG without picking it up!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Boleyn Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Speldhust Close - London Plane tree needs pollarding, 12th September
item.description:
The large London Plane tree in the middle of speldhurst close hasn't been maintained for years. Its canopy and leaf drop is huge and causes a nuisance. Please can it be heavily pollarded this Autumn.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Speldhurst Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on Bus Shelter Sundridge Avenue, 12th September
item.description:
The same graffiti squiggle has been painted on all bus shelters along orchard Road and Sundridge Avenue in black or white paint. Please can all be addressed and removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement blocked, 12th September
item.description:
87 St Johns Wood Terrace, building works. The pavement has been closed off with out any authorisation causing people to cross the road on a busy junction. They have no authority to do this. There should be proper signage and marshalling if anyone has agreed it which I doubt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, St John's Wood Terrace, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement closed constantly for over a week, 12th September
item.description:
Outside Lords Hotel pavement is closed to pedestrians for over a week by roofers . No permit, no signage. Constant obstruction to parking and pavement. People are forced on to the one way street. Previously reported to council over the telephone with no action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Prince's Square, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracked concrete post, 12th September
item.description:
The concrete post is on the top of the steps of Milton Road Belvedere Kent . It is on the green chain route . It looks very dangerous and due to people fly tipping, will eventually fall down. It is a danger to the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milton Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
